item.title: Tourists from England 'could face 14-day quarantine in Scotland'
item.description: https://www.heraldscotland.com/news/18546954.english-tourists-could-face-14-day-quarantine-scotland-covid-19-cases-flare/ Tourists travelling to Scotland from England could reportedly face a 14-day quarantine if Covid-19 cases rise again. Currently, anyone entering Scotland from overseas must go into quarantine for two weeks or face a £480 fine, with similar measures in place in England. The Times reports that a Scottish government source suggested the same could apply to visitors from England if cases rise. The Scottish government said: “We will continue to consider any measures that might be necessary to protect against the risk of imported cases of the virus.

item.title: Sturgeon suggests she could try to BLOCK UK air bridges plan
item.description: https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-8470567/Nicola-Surgeon-hints-try-BLOCK-UK-air-bridges-plan-quarantine-free-holiday-travel.html The MailOnline reports: Nicola Sturgeon hinted she could try to block Boris Johnson’s air bridges plan for quarantine-free travel today. The Scottish First Minister lashed out at the Westminster Government over plans due to be released within days to link the UK with countries with low coronavirus rates. Ms Sturgeon said she was ‘still considering our response and our own proposals’.
